title: Bug 9619 - Move static member: Dialog details
description: Bug 9619Move static member: Dialog details 20020212a. Mnemonicsb. No validation on the type field. Type existence is not too expensive (done in the type wizard for super class), so it could be done. At least isValidTypeNamef. The label could say 'Select destination type:'g. The Browse button is too small (use SWTUtil for standard button sizes)c. Title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it says 'Type not found'. Only types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog.e. The destination type can be the source type: refactoring warns that this will result in errors (which is not true) and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
OB: The Browse button is too small and the title is used for long text. When going to the next page, it displays 'Type not found' even though types from the source folders of the own project should be shown in the dialog. The destination type can be a source type, but the refactoring incorrectly warns that this will result in errors and makes pseudo-changes in all referencing classes.
EB: The Browse button should have a standard size using SWTUtil. The title should not be used for long text, instead it should be displayed correctly. When going to the next page, it should not display 'Type not found'. The dialog should only show types from the source folders of the own project. The refactoring warning should accurately state the consequences of selecting a source type as the destination type.
SR:
1. Open the dialog for moving a static member.
2. Observe that the Browse button is too small and the title is used for long text.
3. Proceed to the next page and see if it displays 'Type not found'.
4. Verify that only types from the source folders of the own project are shown in the dialog.
5. Test the refactoring warning by selecting a source type as the destination type and check if it accurately states the consequences.
